conclusion: Analyzing ion implantation system to determine ion velocity after velocity selector and charge-to-mass ratio selected by magnetic analyzer.
In a velocity selector, crossed electric and magnetic fields select particles with specific velocity.
Electric force is upward and magnetic force is downward in the velocity selector.
For ions to pass straight through without deflection, electric and magnetic forces must balance: qE = qvB.
Solving for velocity gives v = E/B.
Velocity of ions passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
Ions with velocity v = E/B enter the magnetic analyzer.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions experience a magnetic force causing circular motion: F = qvB = mv^2/R.
Solving for charge-to-mass ratio gives q/m = v/(BR).
Substituting v = E/B gives q/m = E/(B^2R).
For ions to pass through magnetic analyzer from aperture M to N, circular path radius must be between R₁ and R₂.
Diagram shows ions following paths with radius R pass through both apertures.
Charge-to-mass ratio of selected ions is q/m = E/(B^2R), where R is the radius of the circular path.
Final answer: Velocity of ions after velocity selector is v = E/B and charge-to-mass ratio is q/m = E/(B^2R).
